column1: 2 ^ Quam dīlecta tabernācula tua Domine virtūtum. ^ How lovely are thy tabernacles

column2: et dēficit anima mea in ātria Dominī; cor meum et carō mea exsultāvērunt in Deum vīvum. ^ my soul longeth and fainteth for the courts of the Lord. My heart and my flesh have rejoiced in the living God.

column3: ubi pōnat pullōs suōs; altāria tua
column6: et Deus meus. ^ For the sparrow hath found herself a house
column7: and the turtle a nest for herself where she may lay her young ones; thy altars

column1: 5 ^ Beātī quī habitant in domō tuā
column2: Domine; in saecula saeculōrum laudābunt tē. ^ Blessed are they that dwell in thy house
column3: O Lord; they shall praise thee for ever and ever.

column1: 6 ^ Beātus vir cujus est auxilium ā tē; ascensiōnēs in corde suō disposuit
column2: ^ Blessed is the man whose help is from thee; in his heart he hath disposed to ascend by steps
in locō quem posuit. ^ In the vale of tears
column3: in the place which he hath set.

column1: 8 ^ Etenim benedictiōnem dabit lēgislātor; ībunt dē virtūte in virtūtem; vidēbitur Deus deōrum in Sion. ^ For the lawgiver shall give a blessing; they shall go from virtue to virtue; the God of gods shall be seen in Sion.

column3: Deus Jācōbis. ^ O Lord God of hosts

column4: et respice in faciem chrīstī tuī. ^ Behold
column6: and look on the face of thy Christ.

column1: 11 ^ Quia melior est diēs ūna in ātriīs tuīs super millia; ēlēgī abiectus esse in domō Deī meī magis quam habitāre in tabernāculīs peccātōrum. ^ For better is one day in thy courts above thousands; I have chosen to be an abject in the house of my God
column2: rather than to dwell in the tabernacles of sinners.

column1: 12 ^ Quia misericordiam et vēritātem dīligit Deus; grātiam et glōriam dabit Dominus. ^ For God loveth mercy and truth; the Lord will give grace and glory.
13 ^ Nōn prīvābit bonīs eōs quī ambulant in innocentiā; Domine virtūtum
column2: beātus homō quī spērat in tē. ^ He will not deprive of good things them that walk in innocence; O Lord of hosts
column3: blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
